publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-8201 John Wilson: Towards a More Equal Scotland?—That the Parliament welcomes the publication of Poverty in Scotland 2011: Towards a more equal Scotland; recognises that this gives a detailed overview of poverty and anti-poverty policies in Scotland, highlighting the main trends and the effects that poverty has on people; acknowledges that poverty is still a major problem in society, and considers that social and economic justice must remain a priority in these difficult economic times.
S3M-8201 Towards a More Equal Scotland? (lodged on 18 March 2011) Des McNulty*, Elaine Smith*, Bill Kidd*, Stuart McMillan*

S3M-8201 John Wilson: Towards a More Equal Scotland?—That the Parliament welcomes the publication of Poverty in Scotland 2011: Towards a more equal Scotland; recognises that this gives a detailed overview of poverty and anti-poverty policies in Scotland, highlighting the main trends and the effects that poverty has on people; acknowledges that poverty is still a major problem in society, and considers that social and economic justice must remain a priority in these difficult economic times. Supported by: Des McNulty, Elaine Smith, Bill Kidd, Stuart McMillan, Hugh O’Donnell*, Patrick Harvie*, Cathy Peattie*, Robin Harper*, Jamie Hepburn*
